main event: On August 18, 1956, a round object was sighted in Tacoma, Washington at an altitude of 3,000 ft.
interesting points: The object appeared the size of a dime at arm's length., It traveled on a westerly course, made no noise, and did not decrease in size., The object flashed at intervals and formed a triangle behind it., It abruptly stopped in mid-air before disappearing suddenly., The report concluded various possibilities, including balloon or aircraft, but stated there was insufficient data for a clear evaluation.
